item.title: Animals and Habitats - Fort Worth Zoo
item.description: The Fort Worth Zoo is home to over a combined 540 species of mammals, birds, and ectotherms.

item.title: Attractions - Fort Worth Zoo
item.description: Feed the giraffes, cool off at the Safari Splash, and race to the top of the Tasmanian Tower at the Fort Worth Zoo.

item.title: Fort Worth Zoo | Zoo in Fort Worth, Texas
item.description: A visit to the Fort Worth Zoo means you can spend your day knowing it all goes back to the caring of nearly 7,000 animals.

item.title: Facts and Figures - Fort Worth Zoo
item.description: The Fort Worth Zoo is home to 68 endangered and threatened species on the state and federal levels. The total number of species in the Zoo’s animal collection includes 160 fish and invertebrates; Zoo collection numbers vary.

item.title: Zoo Map - Fort Worth Zoo
item.description: Planning a trip to the Fort Worth Zoo? Scout your route and get a glimpse of what you’re in store for using the map below.

item.title: Become a Member | Fort Worth Zoo | Zoo Membership in Fort Worth, Texas
item.description: Become a member of The Fort Worth Zoo and enjoy unlimited admission during normal hours, free parking, and special discounts on attractions and events.

item.title: About Us - Fort Worth Zoo
item.description: The Fort Worth Zoo is dedicated to strengthening the bond between humans, the environment, and the animals that live in it through conservation, education, and recreation.

item.title: Habitats - Fort Worth Zoo
item.description: Personally connect with animals in the petting zoo, explore 10 acres of the African Savanna, or spray water into the Elephant pool at the Fort Worth Zoo.

item.title: History - Fort Worth Zoo
item.description: The oldest continuous zoo site in Texas, the Fort Worth Zoo was founded in 1909 with one lion, two bear cubs, an alligator, a coyote, a peacock and a few rabbits. From these humble beginnings, the Zoo has grown into a nationally ranked facility, housing more than 7,000 native and exotic animals.

item.title: Name Our Baby Elephant
item.description: Following a total of six successful elephant calf births and continued involvement in IEF, the Zoo remains an international leader in elephant breeding and conservation.
